name: Copthorne Hotel Sheffield

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed over for 1 night for my birthday end September, lovely friendly staff, clean and modern rooms. I requested before I arrived a higher floor I was given the top floor so 10/10 for communication. Walk into town centre about 10 - 15 mins but wouldnt like to do this alone late at night as some quiet area's to walk through (althought you could stick to main roads) without going too much out of your way. Parking not an issue and we arrived a little earlier than check in time but had no problem getting out room. Free Wi Fi in public area's.
reviews.title: excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there for one night when we went to see westlife on there farewell tour it was a really nice room and and a lovely night staff very friendly and very willing to help you if you have a problem which we did not. nice bar area . breakfast next morning was good with a great choice of food. will definitely stay there again
reviews.title: Relaxing stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've just returned from a one night stay at this wonderful hotel. We were attending a football match at Bramall Lane; the hotel was perfectly located for here! We walked into the city in the evening which took a good 15mins, only a £5 taxi trip back though.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel, perfect location for away football fans!

reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel at about 12.30pm so there was plenty of hotel parking available (if arriving a home game day, the road closes at 2pm until about 6pm which may be an issue for some) We popped into the hotel on the off chance that a room would be ready, we were not disappointed. The lobby area was extremely welcoming, as were the staff. It took all of 5mins to find us a room which was great.
reviews.title: Nice modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was extremely well equipped; tea/coffee making facilities, ironing board, fridge, decent hairdryer etc. It was decorated in a very modern style and the bathroom was lovely. We were on the 3rd floor at the front of the hotel but had no problems with traffic noise.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here as friends were getting married at the Victoria Quays and we wanted somewhere to stay near to this location and that of the reception in Handsworth. We were arriving early-ish on the Sunday, and had called a few days before to see whether we would be able to get into our room before the standard check-in time. We were told that they would try to accommodate us but if not, we could always drop our luggage. As it turned out, we WERE able to get a room, so a good start!
reviews.title: Lovely room, very comfy and generally pleasant hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was lovely - very large, modern and clean; it sounded quite noisy when we came in but once we closed the window, we could not hear a peep from outside.
reviews.title: Handy for the Devonshire Quarter

reviews.text: When we returned from the wedding in the evening we had a drink in the bar which was probably the sort of price you'd expect from a city centre hotel (£7 for a large glass of wine); it was VERY busy and buzzy in the bar which was quite nice.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Poor Location

reviews.text: You could hear people coming and going and doors opening and closing in the corridors quite clearly, but this was really the only noise that we heard whilst in the room. The tea and coffee facilities in the room were fine and fairly standard.
reviews.title: Very impressive

reviews.text: Breakfast the next morning was OK; we were quite late so were at the tail end of the buffet and probably missed more of the "Continental" side of it.
reviews.title: Coming back again!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good points...easy to find, centrally located, free parking, modern & stylish decor, pleasant staff, comfy beds, clean rooms, nice breakfast.
reviews.title: Modern and stylish hotel with free parking
Sheffield stopover
reviews.text: Bad points....mood lighting in the room is lovely for relaxing in, not so great for doing hair & make-up in... i think a man designed the room (my husbands words!) although i could have done my make up in the bathroom, i couldn't have done my hair, as i need a plug socket. One large central light is all that is needed. At dinner the waitress in the hotel's restaurant (called 1855) seemed stressed and reported that they were under staffed that night- just her on. I ordered a fish dish without the parma ham on it, as i do not eat any pork ( i told her this). She said that was fine and half way through me eating the dish i noticed bacon bits in the lentils the fish was served on. When i asked her about it, she said it was a new menu, and she was unaware that there was bacon in the lentils as well as wrapped around the fish. I just picked the bacon out and didn't make a big deal out of it, but really staff should have a better idea of what is in each dish should they are asked.

reviews.title: Well located, modern and clean.....
reviews.text: Over all, good value for money and a very pleasant stay. I would always check that the football ground next door isn't hosting a match that day though!

reviews.title: Excellent Modern Hotel
reviews.text: Good hotel next to football ground. Good service and breakfast. Noisy residents and low level buzzing in room. Overall very pleased with choice. The hotel arranged taxi for outward trip by friendly receptionist. Bar open late at night after returning from concert at the arena.

This hotel is all about location and ease of access with good (and free) parking. Essentially this is a classic case of a modern slick design approach, neutral colours everywhere, calm and stylish. We stayed two nights for a family visit trip, nothing to do with football, a little surprised to find just how close the hotel is to Sheffield United's ground, it's basically adjoining the ground, so DO BE AWARE that on a match day this will be a chaotic place to be. Fortunately we were away all day of the Saturday, didn't return to the hotel until late evening, but we then found the hotel restaurant nearly empty and enjoyed a pleasant meal from a decent and well presented menu, with good prompt service from two excellent waitresses. I may stay again, but may also try a Sheffield hotel with a better outlook/setting, as the surroundings of The Copthorne are borderline industrial. Great car parking (they share the football ground entrance car park, as an overflow to their own bit, both are good and secure + monitored). In summary, great for location and parking, poor for setting and surroundings. You take your pick, but it worked for us, matched our priorities well.
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here after attending a function at SUFC. I had a double room with free continental breakfast.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Check in was easy and the receptionist was helpful and pleasant.
reviews.title: Reunion Dinner

reviews.text: The room was lovely, the bathroom was spacious. I was definatley impressed with the room.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.text: In the morning when we went down for breakfast. We waited to be seated, the manager in the restaurant asked for our room number. Unfortunatly we were not on the list for breakfast. Luckily we had our paperwork with us which showed we could have a continental breakfast. The manager was quite rude and quickly seated us explaining that we could have tea and toast - I am no expert but I thought a continental breakfast consisted of more than tea and toast! We were made to feel quite uncomfortable and this definitely put a downer on our stAy.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.text: Also make sure you close your window as traffic woke us early in the morning, but with the windows closed you can't hear the traffic.
reviews.title: Excellent price for what you get

description: This stylish and modern hotel is situated adjacent to Sheffield United Football Club stadium, close to Sheffield city centre and to some of the area’s top sights and attractions. The hotel has 158 guest rooms, consisting of Standard and Club rooms, and the superb Penthouse Suite.The Copthorne Hotel Sheffield brings modern facilities and welcoming services to the heart of the city and the restaurant at this popular hotel has been awarded an AA Rosette, in recognition of the high quality cuisine that it serves. 18Fifty5 Restaurant specialises in using fresh, local ingredients to produce contemprory dishes with a local flavour.Ideal for leisure and business guests, the hotel offers conference and banqueting facilities for up to 400 guests and also offers complimentary on-site parking.
